snippet: Ehud Barak told biographers that in 2010, 2011 and 2012, he and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu were ready to strike, and why the attacks didn’t happen.
abstract: Ehud Barak, former Israeli defense minister, reveals details regarding Israel’s aborted plans to strike Iranian military facilities in 2010, 2011 and 2012; information, gleaned from interviews between Barak and his biographers, are broadcast on Israel’s Channel 2.
lead_paragraph: Ehud Barak told biographers that in 2010, 2011 and 2012, he and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu were ready to strike, and why the attacks didn’t happen.

headline.main: Israel Came Close to Attacking Iran, Ex-Defense Minister Says
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Israel: New Details on Iran Strategy
